scenes.title: The Sore Loser
scenes.narration_text: Rohan was a boy who loved to win. In fact, he loved winning so much that he hated losing. If he lost a game of marbles, he would get angry and storm off. He didn't know how to be a good sport.
scenes.visual_prompt: School playground. A boy named Rohan looking angry and kicking the dirt after losing a game.

scenes.title: The New Rival
scenes.narration_text: One day, a new student named Surya joined the class. Surya was amazing at badminton. Rohan immediately saw him as a rival and wanted to beat him to prove he was the best.
scenes.visual_prompt: Surya playing badminton gracefully. Rohan watching him from the sidelines with a competitive look.

scenes.title: The Match
scenes.narration_text: They played a match. Rohan was tense and serious, focusing only on the score. Surya, on the other hand, was relaxed. He laughed when he missed a shot and praised Rohan when he played well.
scenes.visual_prompt: Badminton match. Rohan looks stressed and sweaty. Surya looks happy and relaxed.

scenes.title: The Unfair Win
scenes.narration_text: Rohan wanted to win so badly that he cheated when Surya wasn't looking. He won the match, but it was a hollow victory. Surya just smiled, shook his hand, and said, 'Great game, Rohan! That was fun.'
scenes.visual_prompt: Rohan shaking hands with Surya. Rohan looks guilty/conflicted. Surya looks genuinely happy.

scenes.title: The Realization
scenes.narration_text: That night, Rohan couldn't sleep. He realized that Surya didn't care about the score; he cared about the game. Rohan felt ashamed of his anger and his cheating.
scenes.visual_prompt: Night time. Rohan sitting on his bed, looking thoughtful and regretful.

scenes.title: A New Attitude
scenes.narration_text: The next day, Rohan played differently. He laughed when he made a mistake. He cheered for others. He realized that sports are about fun and friendship, not just winning.
scenes.visual_prompt: Rohan playing with other kids, laughing and high-fiving Surya. The atmosphere is joyful.
